common.types

Class Either<A,B>

  • java.lang.Object
    • common.types.Either<A,B>
  • Type Parameters:
    A - The first type to sum
    B - The second type to sum
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Left, Right

    public abstract class Either<A,B>
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple SumType implementation. Allows the creation of the Sum Type A + B. Every instance of Either is either (haha.. tomatoes, rocks) an instance of Left, with a value of type A, or an instance of Right, with a value of type B. The types can be the same, but in that case there isn't much use to using Either. Values stored in either cannot be null.
    Author:
    Mshnik

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      A asLeft()
      Returns the value of this Either as an an instance of A.
      B asRight()
      Returns the value of this Either as an an instance of B.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
      Two Eithers are equal iff:
      - They are both Left or both Right, the only two direct subclasses
      - The objects they store are equivalent using Objects.equals.
      abstract java.lang.Class<?> getType()
      Returns the type of the Object stored within this Either
      abstract java.lang.Object getVal()
      Returns the Object stored within this Either.
      int hashCode()
      Hashes an either based on the value it stores.
      boolean isLeft()
      Returns true if this is a Left, false if this is a Right

        getClass, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • isLeft

        public boolean isLeft()
        Returns true if this is a Left, false if this is a Right

      • asLeft

        public A asLeft()
        Returns the value of this Either as an an instance of A. If the wrapped value is an instance of B, returns null.

      • asRight

        public B asRight()
        Returns the value of this Either as an an instance of B. If the wrapped value is an instance of A, returns null.

      • getVal

        public abstract java.lang.Object getVal()
        Returns the Object stored within this Either. Should have a stricter type bound (A or B) when implemented by subclasses.

      • getType

        public abstract java.lang.Class<?> getType()
        Returns the type of the Object stored within this Either

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Two Eithers are equal iff:
        - They are both Left or both Right, the only two direct subclasses
        - The objects they store are equivalent using Objects.equals.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Hashes an either based on the value it stores. This maintains the hash invariant (two equal objects have the same hashcode), but is not a perfect hashcode because a Left(a) and Right(a) will have the same hashcode but are not equivalent.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
